page.title: 03A TYPICAL SCHOOL MORNING
page.content: I woke up when I heard shouting. Mum was telling my brother off. Dad came in, I closed my eyes and pretended to be asleep but he came over and tickled me. I burst out laughing and wiggled my way out of bed. When dressed I bounded downstairs. I could smell burnt toast! Mum was standing over the sink scraping a slice of toast. I sat at the table and had a bowl of Sugar Frosties. On my way to school I call for two friends. At nine o'clock at school I ring the old Victorian handbell. The school was built over a 100 years ago. Then it's my job to visit all the classes to find out how many children are staying to dinner. During this morning's assembly our class showed the books that we made about our trip to York. I read out a funny bit about a friend doing a striptease on her bunk bed,she was not
